org.assertj.swing.fixture
Interface MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>

Type Parameters:
S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
All Known Subinterfaces:
ItemFixture<S>, JTreeNodeFixture<S>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractButtonFixture, AbstractComponentFixture, AbstractContainerFixture, AbstractJComponentFixture, AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture, AbstractSwingContainerFixture, AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture, AbstractWindowFixture, DialogFixture, FrameFixture, JButtonFixture, JCheckBoxFixture, JComboBoxFixture, JFileChooserFixture, JInternalFrameFixture, JLabelFixture, JListFixture, JListItemFixture, JMenuItemFixture, JOptionPaneFixture, JPanelFixture, JPopupMenuFixture, JProgressBarFixture, JRadioButtonFixture, JScrollBarFixture, JScrollPaneFixture, JSliderFixture, JSpinnerFixture, JSplitPaneFixture, JTabbedPaneFixture, JTableCellFixture, JTableFixture, JTableHeaderFixture, JTextComponentFixture, JToggleButtonFixture, JToolBarFixture, JTreeFixture, JTreePathFixture, JTreeRowFixture
public interface MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>

Simulates mouse input on an AWT or Swing Component.

Author:
Alex Ruiz

Method Summary
 S click()
          Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.
 S click(MouseButton button)
          Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.
 S click(MouseClickInfo mouseClickInfo)
          Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.
 S doubleClick()
          Simulates a user double-clicking this fixture's Component.
 S rightClick()
          Simulates a user right-clicking this fixture's Component.
 

Method Detail

click

@Nonnull
S click()
Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.

Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

@Nonnull

                MouseButton button)
Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.

Parameters:
button - the button to click.
Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

click

@Nonnull
S click(@Nonnull
                MouseClickInfo mouseClickInfo)
Simulates a user clicking this fixture's Component.

Parameters:
mouseClickInfo - specifies the button to click and the times the button should be clicked.
Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given MouseClickInfo is null.
IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.
